name: Aberdeen Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Aberdeen from June 5th - 8th of 2005. I was with a group of 18 people. We all enjoyed the hotel very much for location and cleanliness. The rooms are according to European standards, small. The bathroom was recently remodeled and very nice with just a shower. The air conditioning was good, but could have been better. Annamaria, at the front desk was very helpful to the group. Breakfast was continental but also very good. I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody traveling to Rome. there is a very good restaurant about a block from the hotel, the Il Barroccio. Very good and reasonable for Rome. The hotel is close to a metro station and a bus line. I chose this hotel from the reviews in tripadvisor and was not disappointed.
reviews.title: Just as Expected

reviews.text: We spent 10 days at the Aberdeen and found it to be a greal little hotel. It's across the street from the Italian Dept. of Defense and could not have been safer. The Staff was most helpful and if you are taking a taxi to airport, have the staff arrange, prompt and reasonable, sure beats the train for almost the same price for 2 or more.
reviews.title: Wonderful little hotel
Home at the Aberdeen
reviews.text: Our stay at the Aberdeen was a pleasant one. We (my mom, sister and I) had a triple that overlooked the hotel entrance. It was quiet and spacious for us. Breakfast was plentiful - but then again we don't each much in the morning (bread, yogurt, coffee, milk, juice). Where I think the Aberdeen did excel for us was their concierge and staff - they were extremely helpful and courteous. From the initial contact via e-mail with all hotels (with the Rome hotel search), during our stay, and holding onto our luggage after check-out -- they were fabulous! We didn't have time to utilize all of the hotel's in-house services (e.g., Internet) as we were busy sight-seeing. Ask for special rates, as sometimes they offer discounted rates during certain seasons or to Rick Steves's readers. Ciao e buon viaggio in Italia!

reviews.title: Loved Rome and the Aberdeen Hotel
reviews.text: My husband and I just arrived home from a 5 day vacation in Rome. This was our second trip this year to Italy and both times I used Tripadvisor to find our hotels. The Aberdeen in Rome was lovely. Before we arrived I had corresponded with Annamaria on and off for 4 months. She was wonderful in changing, adjusting and helping us plan our week in Rome. The hotel was perfect for us. Our room was small but it was clean and quiet. There are larger rooms but I stressed the need for quiet. It was and we always had the windows open. The beds were comfortable and although I am a poor sleeper I slept very well in Rome. The entire staff was helpful and suggested wonderful restaurants, helped us find the sights and advised us to take a tour to Naples and Pompei instead of going on our own. It was a good decision and I would highly recommend it. In summary I would say that the Hotel Aberdeen was well located, safe, clean, quiet and made our stay in Rome very enjoyable.

reviews.title: Exceptional Hotel!!
reviews.text: My husband, daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights in March. We had a triple room that was very spacious. We loved the bathroom with its heated towel rack! The hotel and its rooms were immaculate. The breakfast was good (cereal, pasteries, meats, cheese and fruit). Location was terrific - near the train station and we walked to all the tourist sights except the Vatican. The staff went out of their way to give suggestions and directions.

After a long, very warm train trip from Sorrento to Naples to Rome, my new husband and I were greeted with such a wonderful welcome at the Aberdeen Hotel. The staff members treated us so warmly, helped us arrange our tour, and even had cold sparkling wine waiting for us with a sweet message for the last night of our Italian honeymoon. The room was cool, spacious, and very clean. The bathroom also was spacious and picture-perfect. Though we did not spend much time in the room because we tried to see a lot of Rome in a few hours, I would have liked to have spent more time there. I was a little nervous about the proximity to Termini, but the area was just fine. We will definitely come back to the Aberdeen when we come back to Rome. That can't come soon enough!
reviews.title: A Pleasant Oasis

reviews.text: My son and I stayed at Hotel Aberdeen Aug. 12 - Aug. 15 2005. The rooms and hotel were so clean. Staff was wonderful.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a great location.

reviews.text: I will stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.text: Hotel was recommended by Rick Steve's and was very clean, modern, and nice decorated. Family of 4 stayed in a quadruple room which was spacious and had an extra sitting area-small bathroom was very clean. Air conditioning was adequate, though not individually adjustable for the room. Hotel staff was very helpful. Continental breakfast was also very good. Convenient location, felt very safe. Hotel has an elevator, but you must first walk up a flight of steps to get to it. Recommended restaurant, Il Barracio was close-by, good, and reasonably priced. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: We very much enjoyed Hotel Aberdeen during our recent 3 day stay in Rome. Very clean and well appointed. Convenient location near Termini station, 2 blocks from the Republicca metro stop, walking distance to all the sights. Desk staff all spoke good English and were very helpful, including an immediate response to my initial email inquiry. Very reasonable prices. Good continental breakfast buffet. We had a family of 8 staying in two triples and one double. Also recommended by Rick Steves.
reviews.title: Loved the Aberdeen

reviews.text: Stayed at Hotel Aberdeen Jan 29th - Feb 1st 2006 based on advice from Reviews from tripadvisor.This was our first trip to Rome and were pleased with our choice of Hotel.Rooms are small but adequate and were spotlessly clean.Breakfast was cornflakes, Juices,breads, cheese,ham,Tea/coffee.Hotel staff friendly and helpful.Got a good rate on internet 80 euro per room per night including breakfast (winter Special).Location was handy to visit all major attractions on foot 15mins to Trevi fountain, collosseum 15min,Vatican 40mins (taxi 8 euro).Train station and bus station 2 min walk away as was the underground.Used Rome shuttle Limos for Airport transfere (35euro).Booked angeltours for guide of vatican.Liz our guide was excellent and very informative and answered all our questions.Got offical tour of Collosseum (3.5euro).Overall Hotel Aberdeen great value and would book it again.
reviews.title: Great value and great Location

reviews.text: Stayed at the Aberdeen right before Christmas for 2 nights based on recommendations on this site and Rick Steves. Couldn't have been happier with the choice! The location close to Termini makes getting to/from the airport a snap (we took train in, had hotel book a cab for us out at fixed rate of 38 Euros). You can easily walk (15 minutes) to Col/Forum, Trevi, Pantheon, etc. If you're sightseeing, you're going to do a lot of walking in Rome anyway. Underrated is that the Metro is 2 blocks away to get you to St. Peter's. Staff was very courteous and helpful with any questions. Room was great, comfortable, quiet, had second floor with balcony. Agree that breakfast isn't fantastic, but more than enough to get your day started. Note that Rick Steves rate may be lower, we stayed for 91 Euros a night. Stay here, you'll be happy with the Aberdeen!
reviews.title: As advertised - great value and location
Great Stay
reviews.text: We loved this hotel. We stayed for a week and received great service. Great advice on restaurants, sites and how to get to them. We will be back.

Stayed here earlier this month for four nights. Upon arrival was told that I would have to change rooms after the first of four nights. No problem -- I'm flexible. This is a very nice, extremely clean and convenient hotel. The staff is very accomodating and keep a fine hotel. A couple of recommendations: please request a room on an upper floor. While there is no elevator, it's worth it. Both of my rooms were on the ground floor, where late night street noise was incredible! There is a garage in the rear of the building where men congregate at night, talking loudly and starting up cars -- I couldn't figure what was going on out there! All of the racket ended at about 2:00 a.m.
reviews.title: Great Location - ask for a quiet room!
Loved the Hotel Aberdeen
reviews.text: Also, don't get too excited about the breakfast. It's served in a stuffy, windowless room far in the corner of the second floor. The menu never changes. So, if you're there for more than three days, you might want to make alternate breakfast plans - good luck.

We stayed at the Aberdeen Hotel as part of a Rick Steves Tour group. I was very happy with our stay. The hotel's location was good: close to Termini, off of a few main streets (so easy to find), close to the metro and bus stops. The staff was very friendly, the place very clean, the breakfasts simple but yummy.
reviews.title: Nice, clean hotel

reviews.text: My only issue was the water temperature of the shower which felt a bit schizophrenic. Other than that (and really, barely that) it was a nice place to stay.
reviews.title: Home away from home type of hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location. The people at the desk were very nice and helped us a lot with reservations even before we came to Italy. The rooms were very clean and the breakfast was great. We highly recommend to stay in this hotel if you happen to be in Rome.
reviews.title: Great hotel
A true gem!
reviews.text: We were very happy with our stay. The Hotel staff were very helpful, especially Alhandro, he was awesome. He helped us store our luggage when we went to Venice for a day. He also got us a good deal on our taxi to go to the airport. The rooms were clean and not to mention the hotel was in a great location. We will stay there next time we travel to Rome.

We loved the Aberdeen! Sabrina was working the front and she was so helpful and sweet. They had excellent tour information and restaurant recommendations. She booked our car to the airport coming and going. We had a 2 year old with us and let me tell you something....everybody at The Aberdeen loves children! We felt so welcome with a toddler. They gave us a crib to use at no charge.
reviews.title: A Good Choice

description: The Aberdeen hotel has been completely refurbished and is located in a convenient position on walking distance to the main important sites. The rooms are carefully furnished down to the smallest detail and offer all the comforts. It's the ideal place to begin a visit to the Capital or start off on a shopping trip.
